item.title: Saint Chronology
item.description:
• 035 AD, Ignatius of Antioch
  • 069 AD, Polycarp of Smyrna
  • 100 AD, Justin Martyr
  • xxx c, Dionysius the Areopagite
  • xxx c, Clement of Rome
  • 130 AD, Irenaeus of Lyons
  • 240 AD, Anthony the Great
  • 260 AD, Eusebius of Caesarea
  • 329 AD, Gregory the Theologian
  • 330 AD, Basil the Great
  • 335 AD, Gregory of Nyssa
  • 342 AD, Jerome
  • 347 AD, John Chrysostom
  • 580 AD, Maximus the Confessor
  • 676 AD, John of Damascus
  • 949 AD, Symeon the New Theologian
  • 1296 AD, Gregory Palamas

item.title: On The Cosmic Mystery of Jesus Christ
item.description: “Christ, through his ministry of incarnation, death, resurrection, ascension, has overcome both the natural and the unnatural divisions within creation; likewise humanity shares in his ministry of cosmic reconciliation through the multifaceted disciplines of ascetic practice, contemplation, and elevated mystical insight.”
